Class Card

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.softeng.is25am10.model.cards.Card
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
AbandonedShip, Deck, Epidemic, Meteors, Pirates, Planets, Slavers, Smugglers, Space, Stardust, Station, Warzone
public abstract class Card extends Object implements Serializable
Generic class used by all types of cards, it contains the necessary info about every card: if it needs an input by the player (needInput) and some data (getData). We also need to know the type of the card (Type) in some cases.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • Card

      public Card(Model model, boolean needInput, FlightBoard flight, int id, Card.Type type)
      Creates the card by giving the model from which to get player data, such as the number of removed batteries, astronauts or goods.
      Parameters:
      model - where to get the player data
      needInput - does the player need to give some input?
      flight - flight board of the game
      id - unique identification of the card
      type - of the card

  • Method Details

    • isRegistered

      public boolean isRegistered(Player player)
      Checks if the player has already set their input.
      Parameters:
      player - to check
      Returns:
      true if registered, false otherwise

    • unexpected

      protected boolean unexpected(Player player)
      Check if the given player is the one that should declare the next input.
      Parameters:
      player - to check
      Returns:
      true if he's him, false if not

    • allRegistered

      protected boolean allRegistered()
      Check if all the players gave their input
      Returns:
      true if all players did, false otherwise

    • register

      Register a player as having already given the input.

    • set

      public abstract Result<CardInput> set(Player player, CardInput input)
      Give the player's input to the card. If the player does not need to give any input, this method can still be used to give all the players to the card.
      Parameters:
      player - the player that execute the action
      input - this is dependent of every card
      Returns:
      ok if the input is accepted, err if not

    • play

      public abstract Result<CardOutput> play()
      Apply the actions of a card. It is dependent of the specific card.
      Returns:
      ok if succeeded, err if not

      public abstract boolean ready()
      Check if a card is ready to be played.
      Returns:
      true if ready, false otherwise
